body.p: Some respondents to the 2008 ED noted that many financial institutions had recently become government‑related entities when governments took significant and sometimes controlling equity interests in them during the global financial crisis. They queried whether the exemption was appropriate in such cases. In finalising the amendments in 2009, the Board identified no reason to treat such entities differently from other government‑related entities. The Board noted that in addition to the disclosure requirements in IAS 24, IAS 20 Accounting for Government Grants and Disclosure of Government Assistance requires the reporting entity to disclose information about the receipt of government grants or assistance.
